==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|offenen}}, from {{inh|de|goh|offanōn}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*upanōną}}. Compare {{cog|nl|openen}} and {{cog|en|open}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈʔœfnən/}} * {{hyphenation|de|öff|nen}} * {{a|Germany}} {{audio|de|De-öffnen.ogg}} * {{a|Austria}} {{audio|de|De-at-öffnen.ogg}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-weak|öffnet|öffnete|geöffnet}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[open]] {{gloss|to make something accessible or allow for passage by moving from a shut position}} #: {{uxi|de|Das Kind '''öffnete''' die Fenster.|t=The child '''opened''' the windows.}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to open {{gloss|to make accessible to customers or clients}} # {{lb|de|transitive|computing}} to open {{gloss|to load into memory for viewing or editing}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to open, [[get]], or [[answer]] the door # {{lb|de|reflexive}} to open {{gloss|to become open}} # {{lb|de|reflexive}} to [[open up]] (to), [[confide]] (in) {{gloss|to reveal oneself; share personal information about oneself}} ====Usage notes==== While '''''öffnen''''' isn't explicitly formal, it is fairly infrequent in everyday spoken language, typically replaced by the colloquial {{m|de|aufmachen}}. ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-weak|öffn|geöffnet|h|e}} ====Synonyms==== * {{l|de|aufmachen}} ====Antonyms==== * {{l|de|schließen}} * {{l|de|zumachen}} ====Related terms==== {{rel3|de |eröffnen |offen |Öffnungszeiten |Türöffner |Dosenöffner |Flaschenöffner}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
